message.content:
cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.CG, cs.DM. 

The paper deals with probabilistically checkable proofs (PCP) and hardness of approximation, which are topics commonly studied in theoretical computer science. The use of distributed models and the involvement of a third party (Merlin) suggest a focus on complexity theory and communication complexity, which are subfields of cs.CC and cs.IT. The problems studied, such as Bichromatic Maximum Inner Product and Diameter in Product Metric, involve data structures and algorithms, which fall under cs.DS and cs.CG. Finally, the use of inapproximability factors and tightness analysis suggests a focus on discrete mathematics, which is a subfield of cs.DM.
